title: Tiny Books
content: Today on CBS' show Sunday Morning they had a segment on Tiny Books. These books were incredible. Some of them were absolutely tiny I mean the size of finger tips. Now as I sat there in amazement I was wondering are there fonts specifically created for these books? Are there tiny font designers out there?
author: Knight

comments.content: Maybe not the same thing but this was in the news, [http://blog.veer.com/archives/000977.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106195225/http:/blog.veer.com/archives/000977.html "http://blog.veer.com/archives/000977.html") and this is really cool - [http://www.theepochtimes.com/news/6-2-22/38541.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106195225/http:/www.theepochtimes.com/news/6-2-22/38541.html "http://www.theepochtimes.com/news/6-2-22/38541.html") especially the penalties for getting caught.

There is a printer/bookmaker here in SoCal named Eric Wm. Voss who made some tiny books, maybe 1 1/2" - 2" and they were some of the lovliest things I've ever laid eyes on that weren't named Scarlet Johansson or something like that.
[My father](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106195225/http:/www.lib.uiowa.edu/spec-coll/bookcolls/smith%20miniature%20collection/20th%20Century%20U%20S/Levien.htm) made quite a few of these.
